  • Method update top

    Chain Update Service

    Automatically generated from update.js

    Routines

    • Method update(fn) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.update.bind

      If you pass a function to update, it will bind it to the update event. just like jQuerys click() or mouseover().

      Parameters

      • Function fn Listener

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      see jQuery.Chain.services.update.handler

      Automatically generated from update.js

      Example

      • // assuming #person is already chained
$('#person').update(function{
    alert($(this).item().name);
});

$('#person').item({name: 'Rizqi'})

    • Method update(opt) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.update.trigger

      If no argument or "hard" is passed, it will update the element and trigger the update event.

      Parameters

      • String opt If 'hard', it will update each of items

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      see jQuery.Chain.services.update.handler

      Automatically generated from update.js

      Example

      • $('#person').update();

  • Method chain top

    Chain Binding Service. Method to activate the chaining / element rendering service.

    Automatically generated from chain.js

    Routines

    • Method chain(updater) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.chain.handleUpdater

      Updater Handler. If you pass an object to chain, it will treated as a updater object. The updater is a hash of selector and value string: like chain({'my css selector': 'My Content String'}) or chain({'my css selector': {attributes}})

      Parameters

      • Object rules Updater rules to be parsed

      Automatically generated from chain.js

      Examples

      • Usage 

        $(selector)
    .chain({
        // Items anchor, where the Item iteration should be placed
        anchor: anchor,
        // If true, the default updater is overridden
        override: false, 
        // Use custom builder
        builder: function(){},
        // Update the element self
        self: "This is my {data}",
        // Use css selector to update child element
        '.element.selector': "Using String Updater",
        // Use Function as updater
        '.element.selector': function(data, el){},
        // Updating Attributes
        '.element.selector': {
            attribute1: "{attribute}",
            className: "{className}",
            content: "This is the {content}",
            value: "This is the {value}"
        }
    });

      • Using Default Updater 

        $('<div><span class="name">Name</span></div>')
    .item({name: 'Steve Jobs'})
    .chain()
    .appendTo(document.body);

      • Using Custom Updater 

        $('<div><div class="name"><span class="first">First</span> <span class="last">Last</span></div></div>')
    .item({first:'Steve', last:'Jobs'})
    .chain({
        '.name .first': {
            style: 'color: blue;',
            content: 'First Name: {first}'
        },
        '.name .last': 'Family Name: {last}'
    })
    .appendTo(document.body);

      • Attach Builder Inside Updater 

        $('<div><div class="name">Name</div><div class="address">Address</div></div>')
    .item({name:'Steve Jobs', address:'Cupertino'})
    .chain({
        builder: function(){
            var data = this.item();
            this.find('.name').click(function(){alert(data.name)});
            this.find('.address').mouseout(function(){alert(data.address)});
        },
        '.name': '{name}',
        '.address': '{address}'
    })
    .appendTo(document.body);

    • Method chain(fn) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.chain.handleBuilder

      Builder Handler. If you pass a function to chain, it will be handled as {builder: function}, enabling you to use the default updater while customizing the events etc.

      Parameters

      • Function fn Builder Function

      see jQuery.Chain.services.chain.handleUpdater

      Automatically generated from chain.js

      Example

      • $('<div><div class="name">Name</div><div class="address">Address</div></div>')
    .item({name:'Steve Jobs', address:'Cupertino'})
    .chain(function(){
        this.bind('click', function(){
            var data = this.item();
            alert('name:'+data.name+', address:'+data.address);
        });
        
        // if you return false, default builder wont be executed
        // You don't have to return true;
        return true;
    })
    .appendTo(document.body);

    • Method chain('anchor') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$anchor

      Set new Anchor and rerender if new anchor passed. Otherwise return current anchor. If you use items() with chain(), you can use chain('anchor', selector) to move the element, where the items will be generated.

      Parameters

      • Object anchor Anchor element or selector

      Return

      Object current element (if new Anchor passed), otherwise current anchor

      Automatically generated from chain.js

      Example

      • $('#persons').chain('anchor', '.wrapper');

// Define Anchor directly while building
$('#persons').items([...]).chain({anchor:'.wrapper', builder: ...});

    • Method chain('template') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$template

      Getting/Switching Template.

      Parameters

      • Number, String arg Argument

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from chain.js

      Example

      • $(selector).chain('template') // Returns current Template (jQuery Object)
$(selector).chain('template', 'raw') // Returns raw HTML Templates (all)
$(selector).chain('template', nr) // Switch to template nr (read: Number)
$(selector).chain('template', '.tree-column') // Switch by selector

    • Method chain('builder') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$builder

      Get/Change Builder. If you don't pass any argument, it will return the created builder.

      Parameters

      • Function, Object builder (Optional)

      Return

      Function,Object returns builder function, or jQuery Object depends on arg

      Automatically generated from chain.js

      Example

      • $('#el').chain('builder') // returns builder function
$('#el').chain('builder', newBuilder) // Replace Builder

    • Method chain('active') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$active

      Check status

      Return

      Boolean true if active

      Automatically generated from chain.js

    • Method chain('plugin') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$plugin

      Add/Remove Plugins that extend builder

      Parameters

      • String name Plugin Name
      • Function, Boolean fn Plugin Function / False to remove

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from chain.js

    • Method chain('clone') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$clone

      Clone Element unchained, with ID removed.

      Return

      Object jQuery Object containing cloned Element

      Automatically generated from chain.js

    • Method chain('destroy') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$destroy

      Destroy Chain, restore Element to previous condition.

      Parameters

      • Boolean nofollow If true, it won't destroy nested chain elements

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from chain.js

  • Method item top

    Chain Item Service. Method to bind item to object.

    Automatically generated from item.js

    Routines

    • Method item(object) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.item.handleObject

      Edit/Bind Item. If no Object defined, it will bind the object to the Item, otherwise it will alter the object using the provided object.

      Parameters

      • Object obj Object to be inserted

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      see jQuery.Chain.services.item.handler

      Automatically generated from item.js

      Example

      • $('#element').item({name:'Rizqi', country:'Germany'});
$('#element').item({country:'Indonesia'});
$('#element').item(); // Returns {name:'Rizqi', country:'Indonesia'}

    • Method item(fn) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.item.handleFunction

      Add setter and getter to item. This function will change the way item(object) and item() works.

      Parameters

      • Function fn Getter&Setter Function

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from item.js

      Example

      • $(element).item(function(oldval, newval){
    //setter
    if(newval)
        return $.extend(oldval, newval);
    //getter
else
        return oldval;
})

    • Method item() top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.item.handleDefault

      Get Data if no argument passed.

      Return

      Object,Boolean Returns Data Object if exist, otherwise false

      Automatically generated from item.js

    • Method item('update') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.item.$update

      Item Updater, called within $(element).update()

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from item.js

    • Method item('replace') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.item.$replace

      Replace Data with new data

      Parameters

      • Object obj Data Object

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from item.js

      Example

      • $(element).item('replace', data);

    • Method item('remove') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.item.$remove

      Remove Item And destroy it.

      Parameters

      • Boolean noupdate If true it won't update the root element

      Automatically generated from item.js

    • Method item('active') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.item.$active

      Check Status of item

      Return

      Boolean Status

      Automatically generated from item.js

    • Method item('backup') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.item.$backup

      Backup Item to the state before being built.

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from item.js

    • Method item('link') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.item.$link

      Bind Item to other (chained) element. If one of them is updated, the linked element will be updated.

      Parameters

      • Object element element/selector to be linked with
      • String collection Collection to be linked with (has to be "self" if linked to item)

      Return

      Object jQuery Element

      see jQuery.Chain.services.items.collection

      Automatically generated from item.js

    • Method item('destroy') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.item.$destroy

      Destroy item service.

      Return

      Object jQuery Element

      Automatically generated from item.js

  • Method items top

    Chain Items Service. Method to bind items to object.

    Automatically generated from items.js

    Routines

    • Method items(object) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.handleObject

      If a Data Object is given, it will return the item element containing the object if it exists, otherwise empty.

      Parameters

      • Object obj Data Object

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items(element) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.handleElement

      If a jQuery Element is given, it will return itself if it is part of the items, otherwise empty jQuery object.

      Parameters

      • Object obj jQuery Object

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items(array) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.handleArray

      If array is given, it will merge it to current items

      Parameters

      • Array array Array of Data

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items(number) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.handleNumber

      If number is given, it will get the object with the current number. Use -1 to get the last number.

      Parameters

      • Number number Index

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items(true) top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.handleTrue

      If true is given, it will get all items including the hidden one.

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      see jQuery.Chain.services.items.collections.all

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('update') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$update

      Items Updater, called by $(element).update()

      Return

      Object jQuery Element

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('add') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$add

      Add item(s). use items('add', 'shift', item) to add item at the top

      Parameters

      • Object item

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('merge') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$merge

      Merge items with array of item data

      Parameters

      • String cmd Switch for push/shift
      • Array items Item Data

      Return

      Object jQuery Element

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('replace') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$replace

      Replace items with new items array

      Parameters

      • String cmd Switch for push/shift
      • Array items Item Data

      Return

      Object jQuery Element

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('remove') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$remove

      Remove item

      Parameters

      • Object, Number item

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('reorder') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$reorder

      Reorder Item

      Parameters

      • Object item1 Item 1
      • Object item2 Item 2

      Return

      Object jQuery object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('empty') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$empty

      Clear all items

      Return

      Object jQuery object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('data') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$data

      Like items() but returns array of data instead of the jQuery object.

      Return

      Array list of data

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('link') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$link

      Bind Items to other (chained) element. If one of them is updated, the linked element will be updated.

      Parameters

      • Object element element/selector to be linked with
      • String collection Collection to be linked with (has to be "self" if linked to item)

      Return

      Object jQuery Element

      see jQuery.Chain.services.items.collection

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('index') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$index

      Get index of an Item

      Parameters

      • Object item

      Return

      Number index

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('collection') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$collection

      Get collection of items. Define a collection by adding a function argument

      Parameters

      • String col Collection name
      • Function fn Create a collection function

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('active') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$active

      Check Status of items

      Return

      Boolean Status

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('backup') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$backup

      Backup Item to the state before being built.

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('destroy') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$destroy

      Destroy items service.

      Return

      Object jQuery Element

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('filter') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$filter

      Filter items by criteria. Filtered items will be hidden.

      Parameters

      • String, RegExp text Search keyword
      • String, Array properties Search properties

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method items('sort') top

      Also known as jQuery.Chain.services.items.$sort

      Sort items by property.

      Parameters

      • String name sorting property
      • Object opt {toggle:true/false, desc:true/false, type:'number/default'}

      Return

      Object jQuery Object

      Automatically generated from items.js

  • Namespace jQuery.Chain top

    Chain Namespace

    Automatically generated from core.js

    • String jQuery.Chain.version top

      Version Number

      Automatically generated from core.js

    • Array jQuery.Chain.tags top

      Tag for use in jQuery.Chain.parse (which is used in CustomUpdater). It is can be altered.

      see jQuery.Chain.parse

      Automatically generated from core.js

    • Namespace jQuery.Chain.services top

      Namespace containing all defined services.

      Automatically generated from core.js

      • Namespace jQuery.Chain.services.update top

        Chain Update Service Object - Providing methods of update. All method listed here can only be used internally using jQuery.Chain.service or jQuery.Chain.extend

        see jQuery.Chain.service

        Automatically generated from update.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.update.handler top

          Default Handler

          see jQuery.Chain.service

          Automatically generated from update.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.update.bind top

          Also known as update(fn)

          If you pass a function to update, it will bind it to the update event. just like jQuerys click() or mouseover().

          Parameters

          • Function fn Listener

          Return

          Object jQuery Object

          see jQuery.Chain.services.update.handler

          Automatically generated from update.js

          Example

          • // assuming #person is already chained
$('#person').update(function{
    alert($(this).item().name);
});

$('#person').item({name: 'Rizqi'})

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.update.trigger top

          Also known as update(opt)

          If no argument or "hard" is passed, it will update the element and trigger the update event.

          Parameters

          • String opt If 'hard', it will update each of items

          Return

          Object jQuery Object

          see jQuery.Chain.services.update.handler

          Automatically generated from update.js

          Example

          • $('#person').update();

      • Namespace jQuery.Chain.services.chain top

        Chain Binding Service Object - Providing methods of chain. All method listed here can only be used internally using jQuery.Chain.service or jQuery.Chain.extend

        see jQuery.Chain.service

        Automatically generated from chain.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.init top

          Initializer. Executed once at the first time chain invoked.

          see jQuery.Chain.service

          Automatically generated from chain.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.handler top

          Default handler.

          Parameters

          • Object obj Object to be handled

          Return

          Object jQuery Object

          see jQuery.Chain.service

          Automatically generated from chain.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.handleUpdater top

          Also known as chain(updater)

          Updater Handler. If you pass an object to chain, it will treated as a updater object. The updater is a hash of selector and value string: like chain({'my css selector': 'My Content String'}) or chain({'my css selector': {attributes}})

          Parameters

          • Object rules Updater rules to be parsed

          Automatically generated from chain.js

          Examples

          • Usage 

            $(selector)
    .chain({
        // Items anchor, where the Item iteration should be placed
        anchor: anchor,
        // If true, the default updater is overridden
        override: false, 
        // Use custom builder
        builder: function(){},
        // Update the element self
        self: "This is my {data}",
        // Use css selector to update child element
        '.element.selector': "Using String Updater",
        // Use Function as updater
        '.element.selector': function(data, el){},
        // Updating Attributes
        '.element.selector': {
            attribute1: "{attribute}",
            className: "{className}",
            content: "This is the {content}",
            value: "This is the {value}"
        }
    });

          • Using Default Updater 

            $('<div><span class="name">Name</span></div>')
    .item({name: 'Steve Jobs'})
    .chain()
    .appendTo(document.body);

          • Using Custom Updater 

            $('<div><div class="name"><span class="first">First</span> <span class="last">Last</span></div></div>')
    .item({first:'Steve', last:'Jobs'})
    .chain({
        '.name .first': {
            style: 'color: blue;',
            content: 'First Name: {first}'
        },
        '.name .last': 'Family Name: {last}'
    })
    .appendTo(document.body);

          • Attach Builder Inside Updater 

            $('<div><div class="name">Name</div><div class="address">Address</div></div>')
    .item({name:'Steve Jobs', address:'Cupertino'})
    .chain({
        builder: function(){
            var data = this.item();
            this.find('.name').click(function(){alert(data.name)});
            this.find('.address').mouseout(function(){alert(data.address)});
        },
        '.name': '{name}',
        '.address': '{address}'
    })
    .appendTo(document.body);

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.handleBuilder top

          Also known as chain(fn)

          Builder Handler. If you pass a function to chain, it will be handled as {builder: function}, enabling you to use the default updater while customizing the events etc.

          Parameters

          • Function fn Builder Function

          see jQuery.Chain.services.chain.handleUpdater

          Automatically generated from chain.js

          Example

          • $('<div><div class="name">Name</div><div class="address">Address</div></div>')
    .item({name:'Steve Jobs', address:'Cupertino'})
    .chain(function(){
        this.bind('click', function(){
            var data = this.item();
            alert('name:'+data.name+', address:'+data.address);
        });
        
        // if you return false, default builder wont be executed
        // You don't have to return true;
        return true;
    })
    .appendTo(document.body);

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.defaultBuilder top

          Default Builder - Automatic Data filler

          Parameters

          • Function builder Builder Function
          • Object root Root Element Object

          see jQuery.Chain.services.chain.createBuilder

          Automatically generated from chain.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.createBuilder top

          Builder Generator (Wrapper).

          Parameters

          • Function builder Builder

          Return

          Function Wrapped Builder

          see jQuery.Chain.services.chain.defaultBuilder;

          Automatically generated from chain.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.setAnchor top

          Set Anchor (Container for items to be populated, default: this.element)

          Parameters

          • Object anchor Anchor element

          see jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$anchor

          Automatically generated from chain.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$anchor top

          Also known as chain('anchor')

          Set new Anchor and rerender if new anchor passed. Otherwise return current anchor. If you use items() with chain(), you can use chain('anchor', selector) to move the element, where the items will be generated.

          Parameters

          • Object anchor Anchor element or selector

          Return

          Object current element (if new Anchor passed), otherwise current anchor

          Automatically generated from chain.js

          Example

          • $('#persons').chain('anchor', '.wrapper');

// Define Anchor directly while building
$('#persons').items([...]).chain({anchor:'.wrapper', builder: ...});

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$template top

          Also known as chain('template')

          Getting/Switching Template.

          Parameters

          • Number, String arg Argument

          Return

          Object jQuery Object

          Automatically generated from chain.js

          Example

          • $(selector).chain('template') // Returns current Template (jQuery Object)
$(selector).chain('template', 'raw') // Returns raw HTML Templates (all)
$(selector).chain('template', nr) // Switch to template nr (read: Number)
$(selector).chain('template', '.tree-column') // Switch by selector

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$builder top

          Also known as chain('builder')

          Get/Change Builder. If you don't pass any argument, it will return the created builder.

          Parameters

          • Function, Object builder (Optional)

          Return

          Function,Object returns builder function, or jQuery Object depends on arg

          Automatically generated from chain.js

          Example

          • $('#el').chain('builder') // returns builder function
$('#el').chain('builder', newBuilder) // Replace Builder

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$active top

          Also known as chain('active')

          Check status

          Return

          Boolean true if active

          Automatically generated from chain.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$plugin top

          Also known as chain('plugin')

          Add/Remove Plugins that extend builder

          Parameters

          • String name Plugin Name
          • Function, Boolean fn Plugin Function / False to remove

          Return

          Object jQuery Object

          Automatically generated from chain.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$clone top

          Also known as chain('clone')

          Clone Element unchained, with ID removed.

          Return

          Object jQuery Object containing cloned Element

          Automatically generated from chain.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.chain.$destroy top

          Also known as chain('destroy')

          Destroy Chain, restore Element to previous condition.

          Parameters

          • Boolean nofollow If true, it won't destroy nested chain elements

          Return

          Object jQuery Object

          Automatically generated from chain.js

      • Namespace jQuery.Chain.services.item top

        Chain Item Manager - Providing methods of item. All method listed here can only be used internally using jQuery.Chain.service or jQuery.Chain.extend

        see jQuery.Chain.service

        Automatically generated from item.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.item.init top

          Initializer. Executed once at the first time item invoked.

          see jQuery.Chain.service

          Automatically generated from item.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.item.handler top

          Default handler.

          Parameters

          • Object obj Object to be handled

          Return

          Object jQuery Object

          see jQuery.Chain.service

          Automatically generated from item.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.item.handleObject top

          Also known as item(object)

          Edit/Bind Item. If no Object defined, it will bind the object to the Item, otherwise it will alter the object using the provided object.

          Parameters

          • Object obj Object to be inserted

          Return

          Object jQuery Object

          see jQuery.Chain.services.item.handler

          Automatically generated from item.js

          Example

          • $('#element').item({name:'Rizqi', country:'Germany'});
$('#element').item({country:'Indonesia'});
$('#element').item(); // Returns {name:'Rizqi', country:'Indonesia'}

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.item.handleFunction top

          Also known as item(fn)

          Add setter and getter to item. This function will change the way item(object) and item() works.

          Parameters

          • Function fn Getter&Setter Function

          Return

          Object jQuery Object

          Automatically generated from item.js

          Example

          • $(element).item(function(oldval, newval){
    //setter
    if(newval)
        return $.extend(oldval, newval);
    //getter
else
        return oldval;
})

      • Namespace jQuery.Chain.services.items top

        see jQuery.Chain.service

        Automatically generated from items.js

        • Namespace jQuery.Chain.services.items.collections top

          Collection of Function for getting items

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.items.handleObject top

          Return

          Object jQuery Object

          Automatically generated from items.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.items.handleElement top

          Also known as items(element)

          Return

          Automatically generated from items.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.items.handleArray top

          Automatically generated from items.js

        • Method jQuery.Chain.services.items.handleNumber top

          Also known as items(number)

          If number is given, it will get the object with the current number. Use -1 to get the last number.

          Return

          Automatically generated from items.js

    • Method jQuery.Chain.service top

      Register a service to the service manager.

      Parameters

      • String name Service Name
      • Object proto Service Object Prototype

      see jQuery.Chain.extend

      Automatically generated from core.js

      Example

      • Create a Custom Service 

        $.Chain.service('test', {
    // Default command handler
    handler: function(option)
    {
        // do something
    },
    // $(selector).test('what', somearg)
    $what: function(somearg)
    {
        // do something
    }
});

$('#element').test();

    • Method jQuery.Chain.extend top

      Extends service functionalities.

      Parameters

      • String name Service Name
      • Object proto Service Object Prototype

      see jQuery.Chain.service

      Automatically generated from core.js

    • Method jQuery.Chain.jobject top

      Check whether it is a jQuery Object

      Parameters

      • Object obj Object to be checked

      Return

      Boolean True or False

      see jQuery.Chain.jindentic

      Automatically generated from core.js

      Example

      • Using jobject 

        $.Chain.jobject($()) // returns true
$.Chain.jobject("test") // returns false

    • Method jQuery.Chain.jidentic top

      Check whether two jQuery Collection identic

      Parameters

      • Object j1 jQuery Object
      • Object j2 jQuery Object

      Return

      Boolean True or False

      see jQuery.Chain.jobject

      Automatically generated from core.js

      Example

      • Using jidentic 

        a = $('div');
b = $('div');
c = $('div.test');

(a == b) //returns false

$.Chain.jidentic(a, b) // returns true
$.Chain.jidentic(a, c) // returns false
